title: Federal workforce shrinks by 59,000 jobs with 154,000 on paid leave
summary: Department of Labor reported 59,000 federal jobs eliminated by June 2025 under DOGE initiative, with additional 154,000 employees (6% of 2.3 million civilian workforce) participating in deferred resignation program paying full salary and benefits through September 30, 2025 to accelerate exodus of career officials.

sources.title: Officially, 59,000 federal jobs are gone under Trump. There's more to the picture
Federal government paying 154,000 people not to work
At least 148,000 federal employees have left government under Trump, good government group reports
Competing numbers emerge on federal workforce reductions

notes: Labor Department confirmed 59,000 jobs lost by June 4, 2025, with 22,000 in May alone. OPM confirmed 154,000 employees opted into deferred resignation program (6% of civilian workforce), receiving full pay/benefits through fiscal year end Sept 30. Partnership for Public Service tracking shows 148,000 total separations by July 21.
